choices.A: Prioritize the risk and implement treatment options
choices.C: Inform respective risk owners of the impact of exceptions
choices.D: Design mitigating controls tor the exceptions
choices.B: Report the noncompliance to the board of directors

discussion.content:
C 
The information security manager's FIRST course of action should be to inform respective risk owners of the impact of exceptions. This is important because the risk owners are responsible for managing the risks associated with the security controls, and they need to be aware of any exceptions to their controls so that they can take appropriate action. Once the risk owners are informed, they can prioritize the risk and implement treatment options, design mitigating controls for the exceptions, and report the noncompliance to the board of directors as necessary. However, informing the risk owners should be the first step in addressing the issue.

choices.C: Conducting an annual security audit of the system
choices.A: Performing frequent security reviews of the audit log
choices.D: Providing security awareness training to accounting staff

discussion.content:
A. Performing frequent security reviews of the audit log

The most effective way to help assure the integrity of an organization's accounting system is by performing frequent security reviews of the audit log. Monitoring the audit log helps in identifying and addressing any suspicious or unauthorized activities that may compromise the integrity of the accounting system. It allows organizations to detect anomalies and potential security breaches in real-time or shortly after they occur, helping to maintain the accuracy and reliability of financial data.
